title: shining_(arknights)
body:
[i]Shining, Sarkaz healer, will do everything she can to provide medical care for the squad[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Qui'saršinnag[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]175 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]7 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former member of the Sarkaz group, "The Confessors" and current member of the infected assistance group, "The Followers". She is an authority in fields such as Originium Arts, field medicine, medical theories, and clinical medicine. She is now a Medic Operator at Rhodes Island, contributing her knowledge on Originium Arts theories and providing medical support for many an operation.

Although her race is a Sarkaz, which normally represent demons, her motif and appearance is based on traditional Elves.

Her [[voice actor]] is Risa Shimizu.

h4. Skins
* !post #3563817: Base
* !post #3563820: Elite ii
* !post #3697411: [[Shining (Silent Night) (Arknights)|Silent Night]]
* !post #4477410: [[shining_(ambience_synesthesia)_(arknights)| Ambience Synesthesia]]
other_names: シャイニング(アークナイツ)

title: palmar_flexion
body:
When the wrist hangs forward loosely. The opposite of [[dorsiflexion_(wrist)| dorsiflexion of the wrist]].

H4. Potential usage
• [[Embarrassed]] or flattered; an "Oh stop it you!" gesture.
• [[Disgust]].
• Shaking off [[wet]] hands.
• A [[beckoning]] / "Come here" gesture.
• (Japan) when waving the hand horizontally in front of the face - “I can’t help you”, “It wasn’t me”, or “I don’t want it”.
• Wafting a scent either closer or farther away.
• [[Fanning self]] with own hand.
• Showing off a [[ring]] or [[nail polish]].
• "Enchanté"; presenting hand for a kiss.
• [[Checking watch]] gesture.
• 'Dinosaur hands' / 'raptor hands', [[zombie pose]], [[ghost pose]], [[rabbit pose]].
• [[Shooing]] gesture; go away gesture.
• Effeminate gestures: [[girly running]], [[girly boy]]s, etc.
• [[Marionette]] movements; puppet movements.

title: espresso_cookie
body:
[[Cookie Run: Kingdom]] playable character of the Magic class. He debuted on January 21st 2021. 

Hailing from the Crème Republic, Espresso Cookie is a pioneer and proponent of Coffee Magic, researching and experimenting through many sleepless nights to constantly refine his craft. This [[wizard]] occasionally teaches classes on Coffee Magic at the Parfaedia Institute. A serious, intellectual and confident perfectionist with workaholic tendencies and a heart of gold.

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[brown eyes]] with [[slit pupils]] and [[brown hair|brown]]/[[black hair|black]] [[short hair]] with [[hair over one eye]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]]. He wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]].

His outfit is commonly agreed to be consisted of a [[black robe]], [[black cape]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[pink necktie]] and [[black footwear]], though there are variations depending on each artist’s interpretation. 

His English VA is [[Zach Aguilar]].

h4. Costumes
* [[espresso cookie (classy ceremonial suit)|Classy Ceremonial Suit]]

h4. External Links
* "Cookie Run: Kingdom Wiki: Espresso Cookie":https://cookierunkingdom.fandom.com/wiki/Espresso_Cookie

h4. See also
* [[List of Cookie Run characters]]
other_names: エスプレッソ味クッキー

title: leon_the_professional
body: A 1994 French action thriller movie titled [I]The Professional[/I] in the United States and [I]Leon[/I] in the United Kingdom and Australia. It stars [[Jean Reno]] in the title role as [[Leon (Leon The Professional)|Leon]] and features [[Natalie Portman]] making her film debut at the age of just 12 as [[Mathilda Lando]]. It became a surprise hit in Japan and China due to similar themes as many classic Kung-fu movies and a very popular soundtrack CD.

title: schwarz_(arknights)
body:
[i]Schwarz, Operator of Rhodes Island, will protect you from the shadows[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Rim Billiton[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]Individual exhibits memory loss regarding this information.[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]169 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]20 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A guardian of Doycos family and former Bureau Chief of Siesta Urban Public Security Bureau, she joined Rhodes Island at the same time as Ceylon after the Obsidian Festival incident. She has outstanding achievements in covert operations, reconnaissance and anti-reconnaissance, survival, and crossbow usage. She is in charge of protecting the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]] and is responsible for the training of basic level Rhodes Island's operators.

Together with [[Ceylon_(Arknights)|Ceylon]], she is the supporting characters in the side story [i]Heart of Surging Flames ~ Obsidian Festival[/i].

Her motif is based on black panthers.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Itou_Shizuka|Shizuka Ito]].

h4. Skins

* !post #4403944: [[Schwarz (Skyline) (Arknights)|Skyline]] (NPC)
* !post #4464538: [[schwarz_(ambience_synesthesia)_(arknights)|Ambience Synesthesia]]

title: alhaitham_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]].

He is a member of the Sumeru Akademiya's Haravatat who is known as the "Scribe", and is loosely based on [[Su (Honkai Impact)|]] from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

His localized name has a spelling mistake, where it should be written as either Al Haitham or Al-Haitham, with "Al" being translated as "The", which is comparable to writing [[Signora (genshin impact)|La Signora]] as "Lasignora" or [[Statue of The Seven]] as "Statue of Theseven".

title: ugly_man
body:
An unattractive man, often [[old man|old]], [[bald]] and/or [[fat man|overweight]].

In Japanese NSFW works, they are usually used as a "self-insert" device character, and being paired with younger or more attractive women, either through [[rape]] or [[prostitution]]. They are especially prevalent in the [[netorare]] genre, where the character is more commonly called an "ugly bastard".

h4. See also

* [[fat man]]
* [[old man]]
* [[netorare]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Ugly Bastard":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/ugly-bastard]

title: meica_(vtuber)
body:
Argentinian [[Virtual YouTuber]] with a nature theme. Debuted as an [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]], joined [[Idol Corp]] as part of their first Spanish-speaking generation in May 2024, and later graduated after Idol's acquisition by Brave Group in November 2024. She was designed by [[PMasterM]] (early indie) and [[Kisaragi Yuri]].

She has [[heterochromia|heterochromic eyes]] and [[mismatched pupils]], her right eye being [[green eyes|green]] featuring a [[sprout-shaped pupils|sprout-shaped pupil]], while her left eye is [[brown eyes|brown]] with a [[cross-shaped pupils|cross-shaped pupil]]. Her hair is [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], primarily [[brown hair|brown]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair]]. It is of [[medium hair|medium length]] and is styled with [[hair flaps]], a [[single braid]], and an [[ahoge]].

h4. Costumes

title: diesel_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of Infinity Rail.

She is the leader of Infinity Rail who took [[Brid (nikke)|]]'s place and has a fondness for strawberry candies. She operates the AZX, the Ark's high-speed train.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[military hat|military]] [[peaked cap]], [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[military jacket|military]] [[jacket on shoulders]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue necktie|blue]] [[striped necktie]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[thigh belt]], [[thigh pouch]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Usually depicted [[holding gun|holding]] an [[rpk]] [[light machine gun]].

In her past life as a human, Diesel was a member of the AFX, a locomotive that is likely the predecessor to the AZX, alongside the people who would later be known as Brid and [[Soline (nikke)|]] respectively. However, a terrorist bombing instigated by [[Crow (nikke)|]] occurs, killing Diesel alongside her little brother and the other passengers of AFX. All the female passengers killed eventually became Nikkes who worked in the railways.

h4. Official art
* !post #5907391: Default

* !post #7531050: [[Diesel (Midnight Strawberry) (Nikke)|Midnight Strawberry]]
* !post #6739876: [[Diesel (Strawberry Flower) (Nikke)|Strawberry Flower]]
other_names: ディーゼル(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: dream_smp
body:
The Dream SMP was a private, whitelisted survival multiplayer [[Minecraft YouTube|Minecraft]] server played on by the Dream Team and their friends. It is famous for being a roleplay themed server with a mostly improvisational plot and a long history of alliances, wars, factions, eras, and characters. Livestreams, VODs, and server highlights can be found on Twitch and YouTube.

For a list of characters, see [[List of Minecraft YouTubers]].

title: desert
body:
An arid, barren environment. Usually covered in predominantly [[sand]] or very loose soil with few animals and plants (e.g. [[palm tree]]s and [[cactus|cacti]]) which can survive with very small amounts of water.

Commonly featured in Middle Eastern setting or [[post-apocalypse]] fiction to show that resources are scarce or some event has killed most of the life on Earth.

[b]Not to be confused[/b] with sweet food items consumed at the end of a meal, known as a [[dessert]].

h1. See also
* [[bare tree]], [[bare bush]]
* [[beach]]
* [[desert camouflage]]
* [[mesa]]
* [[oasis]]

title: ginga_hyouryuu_vifam
body:
[b][i]Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam[/i][/b] (銀河漂流バイファム, [i]"Galactic Drifter Vifam"[/i]) is the name of a [[mecha]] anime television series (and its eponymous robot, the [[Vifam]]) created by Sunrise in the early [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

Vifam premiered in Japan on Japan News Network's TV stations (including MBS and [[TBS]]) between October 21, 1983 and September 8, 1984. It was directed by Kanda Takeyuki and included mechanical designs by legendary artist [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by the late [[Ashida Toyoo]].

Set in the far future, the plot of the show narrates the adventures of a group of children and teenagers who try to flee the invasion of their colony planet by hostile aliens while escaping aboard [[janus_(ginga_hyouryuu_vifam)|a giant spaceship equipped with several mecha]].

"The show's intro theme":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qwszwb3aIPg ("Hello Vifam") was composed and performed by the Japanese progressive rock band [b]TAO[/b]. This theme is one of the first Japanese animation title songs written entirely with [[english_text|English]] language lyrics.

A sequel television anime, [i][b]Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam 13[/b][/i] (銀河漂流バイファム13), aired on MBS and its affiliated networks between March 21, 1998 and October 3, 1998. The first series was also later re-run in Japan on Animax in December 23, 2006.

title: octane_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]], added in Season 1. A daredevil with [[mechanical legs]] who utilizes stims for faster movement.

Octane's default outfit consists of a [[green vest|green]] [[cropped vest]] that exposes his [[abs]], a pair of [[grey shorts]], and a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]. His face is obscured by the combination of a [[mouth mask]], [[goggles]], and a piece of [[black headwear]], though official art later revealed his appearance. Underneath the mask he has [[brown eyes]], a [[stubble]] [[beard]], and [[undercut]] [[brown hair]] with [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], though anime-styled fanart will often instead portray him with solid green hair and [[green eyes]] under the mask.

He often makes a [[\m/]] gesture and has an [[arm tattoo]] that reads "PLUS ULTRA" on his left arm. His heirloom weapon is the [[Butterfly Knife (apex legends)|]]. Octane grew up on [[Olympus (apex legends)|]] and is a childhood friend of [[Lifeline (apex legends)|]], as well as the son of syndicate leader and crime boss [[Eduardo Silva]]. Often pictured holding large [[syringe]]s used to inject stim fluid for his tactical ability. Images featuring Octane may feature [[Spanish text]], as overseas dubs retain Spanish words and phrases as part of his voice lines.

title: balancing_egg
body:
This tag refers to the act of [[balancing]] an [[egg]].  This is may refer to a tradition where this is done in China on [[Chinese New Year]], when a myth states that this can only be done on this date.  The tradition has been adopted by western nations, adapting the myth to say that they can only be balanced on the vernal equinox or at the equator. In reality it can be done at any place or time of year but is difficult due to eggs' natural shape and composition.

title: finch
body:
"Finch" is an imprecise term for type of small perching [[bird]]. "True finches" are small to medium-sized birds in the family Fringillidae, containing more than 200 species. It includes species known as siskins, canaries, redpolls, serins, grosbeaks and euphonias.

Finches have stout conical bills adapted for eating seeds and often have colorful plumage. They occupy a great range of habitats where they are usually resident and do not migrate.

Many birds in other families are also commonly called "finches". These groups include: the estrildid finches (Estrildidae) of the Old World tropics and Australia; some members of the Old World bunting family and the American sparrow family; and the Darwin's finches of the Galapagos islands, now considered members of the tanager family.

h4. See also
* [[American Goldfinch]]
* [[Double-barred Finch]]
* [[Eurasian Bullfinch]]
* [[Gouldian Finch]]
* [[Japanese Grosbeak]]
* [[Java Sparrow]]
* [[Zebra Finch]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: robbie_the_rabbit
body: Robbie the Rabbit is an anthropomorphic rabbit doll that has made appearances in many of the [[Silent Hill (series)|]]  games. In some of his appearances, his mouth is covered with blood. For the most part his appearance seems to serve little more than to provide an ambiguous level of unease to the player, due to the odd nature of his existence within the world of Silent Hill, his bright colours compared to the rust brown and dark red of everything else, and his recurring cameos.

title: yuru-chara
body:
Japanese term for a category of [[mascot]] characters; usually created to promote a place or region, event, organisation or business. They are characterized by their kawaii (cute) and unsophisticated designs, often incorporating motifs that represent local culture, history or produce. They may be created by local government or other organizations to stimulate tourism and economic development, or created by a company to build on their corporate identity. They may appear as costumed characters (or [[kigurumi]]) at promotional events and festivals. Yuru-chara has become a popular and lucrative business, with character-driven sales reaching nearly $16 billion in Japan in 2012.

Popular yuru-chara include [[Kumamon]], [[Funasshii]], and [[Chiitan]], who have gained international recognition and have reached celebrity status in Japan.

h4. External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuru-chara

A minor [[meme]] related to pregnancy tests cropped up in late 2014, where a feminine finger pointing to a pregnancy test would be added into existing images. (See post #1824996 and its parent.)

title: frieza
body:
[b]Frieza[/b] is one of the main antagonist of the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, first introduced in [[Dragon Ball Z]] as the titular main antagonist of the Frieza Saga. 

The Emperor of Universe 7, he was responsible for the genocide of the Saiyans. His goal in the original appearance is to find the Namekian [[Dragon Ball (object)|]]s to grant him the wish for immortality. He first appears in his [[1st form frieza|1st form]], before going through each ([[2nd form frieza|2nd form]] and [[3rd form frieza|3rd]]), before revealing his [[final form frieza|final form]] (which he can charge up to [[full power frieza|full power]]). His last appearance in the original manga would see him [[mecha frieza|mechanically enhanced]].

Best known for his cold, arrogant, and egotistical altitude, along with his sadistic tendencies towards his enemies or anyone belonging to the race he deemed inferior, both verbally and physically. This later became an archtypical trait of several all-powerful and self-centered villains in various manga and anime. He also has a rivalry with his non-canonical older brother, [[Cooler (dragon ball)|]].

His [[Frieza clan|clan]] is known for having multiple forms and named after cold objects. He returns in [[Dragon Ball Super]] with new forms, [[Golden Frieza]] and [[Black Frieza]], themed after credit card levels, the first featuring prominently across Frieza's appearances in Super.

He has several subordinates, prominently including:

* [[Zarbon]]
* [[Dodoria]]
* [[Ginyu Force|The Ginyu Force]]
** [[Captain Ginyu]]
** [[Jeice]]
** [[Burter]]

title: jikan_sokougun
body:
The enemies of [[Touken Ranbu]], which come from the future to change history in their favor. Like their [[Kantai Collection]] counterparts the [[abyssal ship]], they are notably monstrous in looks. Weaker enemies resemble skeletons, while tougher enemies appear human. Others are somewhere in between these two states in a [[centauroid]] fashion, with the humanlike upper half attached to a skeleton creature.

Frequently characterized by their [[pale skin]], undead appearance, and deathly [[aura]] (often green, but can be red or purple). Their character design is done by [[Ishitsu Kenzou]], artist of [[Tonbokiri_(touken_ranbu)|]].

Although there are not direct analogues to the Touken Danshi, fanart tends to create [[dark persona|corrupted versions]] of them similar to the Revisionists.

Also known as the [i]Retrograde Forces[/i] or [i]Historical Revisionists[/i].

h4. List of Enemies

title: kaga_(battleship)
body:
The Japanese aircraft carrier [[Kaga (aircraft carrier)|]] portrayed as a [[battleship]] instead.

[i]Kaga[/i] was originally planned and constructed as a [i]Tosa[/i]-class battleship, before that class of ships was rendered superfluous (while still under construction) by the 1922 Washington Naval Treaty. [i]Tosa[/i], the lead ship of the class, was expended as an armor test target, but [i]Kaga[/i] was spared that fate by the destruction of the battlecruiser-turned-carrier [i]Amagi[/i] in the 1923 Great Kanto Earthquake, which led to her hull being converted into a carrier instead.

h4. See also

* [[Kaga (Battleship) (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Kaga (Battleship) (Kancolle)]]

title: gitano_(arknights)
body:
[i]Gitano, Caster Operator of Rhodes Island, will draw plans for the squad with her Originium Arts.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Ragna

h4. Profile

A mystic from Sami, tarot expert and a great card player. She has never spoken to anyone of her past prior coming to Rhodes Island, and it remains a mystery. All anyone knows is that her readings are very accurate. Divination is a hobby to her that she does almost for free, accepting fruits and cakes as a token payment. Also knows countless other card tricks, and unless she's caught red-handed, she'll never admit to cheating.

Her motif is based on [[reindeer]]s. Her callsign is Spanish for [i]gypsy[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is Kana Yuuki.

title: carole_&_tuesday
body:
Fifty years have passed since mankind began migrating to the new frontier: Mars. It's an age where most culture is produced by AI, and people are content to be passive consumers.

There's a girl. Scrapping a living in the metropolis of Alba City, she's working part time while trying to become a musician. She's always felt like something is missing. Her name is Carole.

There's a girl. Born to a wealthy family in the provincial town of Herschel City, she dreams of becoming a musician, but nobody around her understands. She feels like the loneliest person in the world. Her name is Tuesday.

A chance meeting brings them together. They want to sing. They want to make music. Together, they feel like they just might have a chance. The two of them may only create a tiny wave. But that wave will eventually grow into something larger...
other_names: キャロル&チューズデイ
キャロル_チューズデイ

title: maou_evelogia_ni_mi_wo_sasage_yo
body: Known in English as Everything for Demon King Evelogia. An web anime (ONA) under the category [[yaoi|Boys Love]], Fantasy, Erotica and Isekai. It premiered between Oct 2, 2021 to Nov 27, 2021. Its runtime is 6 minutes, with 9 episodes total. Ever since he laid hands on his favorite game, [[Toshiaki Gozu]] has admired its loathsome main villain: the demon king [[Evelogia]], detested by all yet a character accompanied by loneliness his entire life. [br] With his past crimes having caught up to him, Toshiaki is held hostage at gunpoint by a yakuza and is ultimately killed. Following his untimely end, he finds himself in a surprisingly familiar room—a setting of the game where Evelogia exists. Although the revelation delights him, disappointment creeps in as Toshiaki realizes that he is the character who is destined to assassinate the great demon king. [br] However, Toshiaki rejects his role and instead allies himself with Evelogia. Now with someone trustworthy by his side for the first time ever, Evelogia is emotional. But living regular lives proves to be challenging for both of them; Evelogia wields uncontrollable destructive power while Toshiaki grows dangerously obsessed with the antagonist.
other_names: 魔王イブロギアに身を捧げよ

title: distorted_halo
body:
Not to be confused with [[glitched halo]], which is not used to represent sensations and is a separate type of halo rather than a distortion of the classic halo.

Halo that differs from the standard one by the presence of interference or distortion. Caused by strong sensations that the characters experience. An artistic technique used by [[Blue Archive]] artists to depict [[orgasm]] and is mostly used when depicting sex scenes.

Halo is also officially a representation of consciousness, and its distortion may indicate that the character is beginning to lose consciousness.

Types of distortion in descending order:
1. Post #7905335 - [b]Interference[/b]
2. Post #7927660 - [b]Deformation[/b]
3. Post #6782418 - [b]Fading[/b]
4. Post #7944266 - [b]Wind[/b]

title: jungle_cat_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She first appeared in the original 2015 mobile game, and later appeared in [[Kemono Friends 3]] with an updated character design. Contrary to the name, the jungle cat is not a species that inhabits jungles; nonetheless, Friends of Japari Park seem to think that Jungle Cat is a wild feline tempered by the perils of the jungle. Consequently, she feels she has to maintain that illusion— lest other Friends decide she is uninteresting— but she simultaneously resents this and wishes she could be honest.

In September 2022, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on Jungle Cat debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as a member of its second wave, debuting alongside [[Brown Long-Eared Bat (Kemono Friends)|Brown Long-Eared Bat]] and [[Siberian Chipmunk (Kemono Friends)|Siberian Chipmunk]]. Known for her gentle and mature voice, KemoV's Jungle Cat is a talented artist who often makes art for herself and other KemoV members, including emotes and channel assets, and is a skillful gamer who is an [[Apex Legends]] veteran. She sports a great knowledge of horse racing and cars.

h4. External links

* "Jungle Cat (KemoV)'s YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtJSUW-5FnwfaivXpluABWA
* "Jungle Cat (KemoV)'s Twitter":https://twitter.com/Junglecat_KEMOV
* "Jungle Cat (KemoV)'s Twitch":https://www.twitch.tv/junglecat__kemov
other_names: ジャングルキャット(けものフレンズ)

title: dorsiflexion_(wrist)
body:
Bending the wrist far backward, either by means of letting it fall backwards limply, or having it pressed up against something. The opposite of [[palmar flexion]]. 

h4. Usage examples
* "No thanks"; "I don’t want it" gesture.
* [[Rejection]]; "Go away" gesture.
* Indicating towards something. (Note that in Japan, [[pointing]] with one's finger may be considered rude, so using the whole hand is a polite/formal alternative).
* "Effeminate poses"; [[girly running]], [[girly boy]], etc.
* "Why?" gesture.
* "Rebellious", "bratty" body language; [[mesugaki]] and [[osugaki]].
* "Give it to me" gesture.
* [[Beckoning]]; "come here".
* "Hand shrug" / "I don't know" gesture; [[confused|confusion]].
* [[Stretching]] poses (e.g post #4390381).
* [[Shading eyes]].

title: siberian_chipmunk_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She first appeared in the original 2015 mobile game, and later appeared in [[Kemono Friends Pavilion]] and [[Kemono Friends 3]], in 2020 and 2022 respectively, with an updated character design. She is typically depicted as an energetic and driven character who enjoys foraging.

In September 2022, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on Siberian Chipmunk debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as a member of its second wave, debuting alongside [[Brown Long-Eared Bat (Kemono Friends)|Brown Long-Eared Bat]] and [[Jungle Cat (Kemono Friends)|Jungle Cat]]. In April 2024, Siberian Chipmunk graduated from the KemoV Project amicably and on her own terms, becoming the project's second graduate after [[African Penguin (Kemono Friends)|African Penguin's]] graduation two years prior. KemoV's Siberian Chipmunk was known for her confident and upbeat personality, her keen intellect, and her gaming prowess.

h4. External links

* "Siberian Chipmunk (KemoV)'s YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKob71cjOlyYF5bgvtGuNKQ
* "Siberian Chipmunk (KemoV)'s Twitter":https://twitter.com/Shimarisu_KEMOV

title: african_penguin_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character and one of the many "Friends" in Japari Park. African Penguin, also sometimes known as Cape Penguin, first appeared in [[Kemono Friends Pavilion]] and has since appeared in [[Kemono Friends 3]]. She looks up to [[Humboldt Penguin (Kemono Friends)|Humboldt Penguin]] and is sometimes shown to have a competitive but sisterly dynamic with her.

In April 2021, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on African Penguin debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as one of its founding members, alongside Humboldt Penguin; similarly to their in-game counterparts, these two posed as sisters. In May 2022, African Penguin graduated from the KemoV Project amicably and on her own terms, becoming the first graduated member of the project.

title: lyza_(made_in_abyss)
body:
Character From [[Made in Abyss]].

Lyza "[i]The Annihilator[/i]" is [[Riko_(made_in_abyss)|]]'s mother. Lyza is a legendary white whistle delver who accomplished many great discoveries about the secrets of the Abyss. She is known as the Lord of Annihilation for her tendency to exterminate all enemies she encountered within the Abyss, be it dangerous beasts or delvers from other countries.

In her canonical appearance, Lyza has a [[very long hair|very long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] with curls at the ends that reaches her knees, large [[blue eyes]], and a light skin-tone. Her attire consists of a [[red jacket]] and a [[brown helmet|brown]] [[helmet]].

title: star_wars_manga
body:
A late 90s official manga adaptation of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] films by Japanese artists and released in both America and Japan by "Dark Horse comics":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Horse_Comics in 1998. 

To conform to Western standards, for the English versions the art was copied in mirror-image in order to be read from left to right.

While the manga's artwork was entirely done by Japanese artists, the cover art for each volume of the manga was done in [[artist collaboration|collaboration]] by Westerner artists [[Joe Wight]] and [[Adam Warren]] in the manga series [[official style]] (mostly).

title: artist_request
body:
A request for the artist of a post.

Do not use this tag if there is a source available, such as the artist's homepage, blog, Pixiv, etc. Read [[Howto:Artist]] and create a new artist tag yourself, or ask for help in topic #8199: Artist tagging help.

It might be possible to find the artist with the help of a Reverse Image Search engine (see [[Help:Image source]]).

If the post is an [[artist collaboration]] and there's at least one artist tag present, use [[collaboration request]] as well.

h4. See also

* [[collaboration request]]
* [[source request]]
* [[tagme]]

title: check_artist
body:
The artist(s) for a particular post has been identified, but a second opinion is needed for verification. Can be used when the post is retrieved from a source that is not owned by the artist in question (ie. [[third-party_source]], certain Twitter accounts, music albums, etc).

Do not use this tag if the source data already provides the artist's name. An exception to this is when the post in question consists of an [[artist collaboration]] between two or more artists.

title: collaboration_request
body: Used along with [[artist request]] when not all artists of an [[artist collaboration]] are known.

title: 2024_niconico_cyberattack
body:
On June 8th, 2024, [[NicoNico]] experienced a cyber attack that caused the site to go down, leaving only a blog message from the management team for anyone attempting to use the site.

Users on social media made art to support the team as they worked to bring NicoNico back online with the hashtag "#がんばれニコニコ運営":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/%E3%81%8C%E3%82%93%E3%81%B0%E3%82%8C%E3%83%8B%E3%82%B3%E3%83%8B%E3%82%B3%E9%81%8B%E5%96%B6] (Do your best, NicoNico management).

On June 14th, NicoNico management gave an "update":[https://twitter.com/nico_nico_info/status/1801495272163525035] that it would take over a month for services to be restored.

At the end of July, NicoNico management announced that they would be reviving services on August 5th.

h4. See also
* pool #5960 (Current Events)

h4. External links

* "NicoNico Info (blog by management)":[https://blog.nicovideo.jp/niconews/225099.html]
* "June 14th update tweet":[https://twitter.com/nico_nico_info/status/1801495272163525035]
* "Update announcing revival of services on August 5th":[https://blog.nicovideo.jp/niconews/225330.html]
other_names: がんばれニコニコ運営
負けるなニコニコ運営
ニコニコ復活おめでとう

title: collaboration
body: For collaborations between multiple artists, use [[artist collaboration]]. For crossovers, use [[crossover]].

title: second-party_edit
body: Like [[third-party edit]], except the one doing the editing is a second-party to the work (such as its [[commission|commissioner]]) rather than a third-party.  If the commissioner is also an artist themselves, the distinction between this and [[artist collaboration]] may become blurry.

title: yamoge
body:
Doujin novelist / fanfic story creator / writer. Usually asks other artists to draw art for [[Artist collaboration|his doujin novels]]. 
He often uploads doujin [[cover_page|cover pages]] and samples to his Pixiv account with permission of the real artists.

Note that most images posted on their accounts [[second-party source|aren't drawn by him]], and the doujins are usually drawn by two (front cover, other illustrations and back cover) or more artists. The commentary, image or product page will give it away, as he will usually credit the artists by either mentioning their name or linking their Pixiv or Twitter accounts. Please try to be careful and tag the original artists of the images.

title: u-101_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German submarine U-101. Character design by [[Yano Mitsuki (nanairo)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]] with a white vertical stripe to the front, an [[Iron Cross]] medal on a red [[sash]], [[headphones]], [[black hat|black]] [[baseball cap]] with another Iron Cross, [[black gloves]], [[black bikini]] with [[multi-strapped bikini|multiple straps]], black [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black socks|sock]] on her right and [[black thighhighs|thighhigh]] on her left), and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is themed like an animalistic motorbike (with bike handles) and patterned off her real-life hull.

title: aoba_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Aoba[/i].

She is portrayed with [[messy_hair|messy]] [[pink hair]] or [[purple hair]] (depends on the artist) tied into a [[ponytail]] and held by a [[scrunchie]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[white shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue collar]] and a yellow [[neckerchief]], and blue [[shorts]].  She also wears [[black_thighhighs|black]] [[thighhighs]].  

Her [[rigging]] consists of a pair of 203 mm twin gun mounts carried on a strap like a purse on her right, with a [[flight deck]] on her left.  On her back, she carries a mockup of the real ship's bridge like a backpack.  

In the "supplementary material for the 2016 anime film":[https://twitter.com/tayotayo1224/status/1518217102226001920], Aoba is revealed to have a second remodel/kai ni, but remains unimplemented in-game due to her original artist [[Hatsuko]] no longer in touch with C2 Kikan since 2015. Her kai ni transforms her back rig to her real-life bridge superstructure with a mast, a crane on the left/portside, and a catapult on the right/starboard. Her two 20.3 cm twin mounts are also remounted to a new portable rig similar to [[Kinugasa Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]. In addition, she also gains a third 20.3 cm twin mount attached to the left side of her shorts. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #1964044

h4. Personality and history

The historical Aoba famously had a war correspondent onboard, and as such, Aoba has been made out into being the "reporter shipgirl.":/pools/8444 At best, this makes her optimistic and enthusiastic, but at worst, she's portrayed as a stalker or paparazzi (whether she's portrayed as one or the other is largely artist- and/or story-dependent).  (In fact, due to the heavy overlap of artists between [[Touhou]] and Kantai Collection, she's oftentimes just drawn by former Touhou artists as [[Shameimaru Aya]] with the serial numbers filed off, due to the shared reporter stereotypes.) 

Historically, [i]IJN Aoba[/i] was the flagship of Cruiser Division 6, which consisted of her sister ship, [i][[Kinugasa (kancolle)|Kinugasa]][/i], as well as [i][[Furutaka (kancolle)|Furutaka]][/i] and [i][[Kako (kancolle)|Kako]][/i]. She served in numerous naval battles like Coral Sea and Leyte Gulf before being sunk in an air raid in Kure in July 1945.  

h4. [i]Aoba[/i]-class Heavy Cruisers
* [b]Aoba[/b]
* [[Kinugasa (Kancolle)]]

h4. See also
* [[Aoba (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Aoba[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Aoba]

title: yuru_yuri
body:
A manga series by [[namori]], serialized in Comic YuriHime since 2008, and adapted into an anime in the Summer of 2011. A second anime season was released in the summer of 2012. An OVA titled Yuruyuri Nachu Yachumi! was released in 2014. During a event related to OVA's release a 3rd season was announced to be come in production early 2015. The third season, called "YuruYuri San Hai!", aired in October 2015.

Yuru Yuri follows the everyday life of schoolgirls at a fictitious junior high school. The year before the series starts, [[Toshinou Kyouko]] and [[Funami Yui]] take over the former room of the school's Tea Ceremony Club to form the Amusement Club. When Kyouko and Yui's friend [[Akaza Akari]] enters their school, she immediately becomes part of the club. One of Akari's classmates [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]] also ends up joining the club. Members of the student council often visit the club.

Spin-offs have been made: [[Oomuro-ke]], [[Risetto!]], [[Touzainanboku!]] and [[Tensei Shitara Akari dake ga Slime Datta Ken]].

title: rejection_reaction_(meme)
body:
[tn]Meme name still pending[/tn]

A facial expression of amazement and shock.

During an [[Apex Legends]] stream, [[Dokibird_(vtuber)|]] was grouped up with two other players who knew each other and were talking in voice chat.
The atmosphere started somewhat intimate with Dokibird quietly listening in on the conversation, until one person asked if the other one was still with someone else.
The answer was "[I]Yeah. He is right next to me [...][/I]" at which point the atmosphere dramatically shifted to awkward. The clip went viral, with Doki's exaggerated expression becoming a topic of redraws and discussion about advancements in vtuber model tracking.

title: shiniyuku_kimi_yakata_ni_mebuku_zouo
body:
"Shiniyuku Kimi, Yakata ni Mebuku Zouo" is an adult visual novel game set in a mysterious mansion filled with dark secrets.
The story revolves around a protagonist who becomes entangled in a web of hatred and despair within the mansion.
As the narrative unfolds, players must navigate complex relationships and uncover hidden truths, all while dealing with intense emotions and psychological horror. 
The game is known for its dark themes, intricate storytelling, and atmospheric setting.

title: bullpup
body:
A type of non-handgun [[gun|firearm]] configuration where the action is located behind the trigger group/housing and alongside the shooter's face, instead of in front as in conventional designs. This permits the [[weapon]] to be shorter for the same barrel length, improving maneuverability and reducing weight.

Basically, in a normal gun, the [[magazine (weapon)|]] is in front and the trigger is behind. In a bullpup firearm, the trigger is in front and the magazine is behind.

title: looking_to_the_side
body: When a character's gaze is directed to something off to their side. Most commonly are eyes looking 90 degrees across the shoulder, but may also include up to 45 degrees facing in either direction. [[Looking to the side]] is relative to the character's front, not the viewer's perspective. If the eyes are directed more than 45 degrees backwards use [[looking back]] instead. If the character looks to the side without moving their head, combine with [[sideways glance]]. Not to be confused with [[averting eyes]], where someone deliberately diverts their gaze from the viewer/others out of [[embarrassed|embarrassment]] , [[angry|anger]], [[annoyed|annoyance]], etc. h4. Examples * !post #5121424 * !post #2676360 * !post #3013073 h4. See also * [[looking ahead]] * [[looking at viewer]] * [[looking up]] * [[looking down]] * [[looking back]] * [[shaft look]] * [[sideways glance]]

body:

Garter belts are distinct from [[legwear garter]]s, which are worn around the leg to hold up legwear.

Note: Do not use [[garter straps]] with this tag. If only the straps are visible, use [[garter straps]] instead. If both the straps and the belt are visible, use [[garter belt]].

title: playboy_bunny
body:
A character wearing a Playboy bunny outfit, also known as a "bunnysuit" or a "bunny girl".

A stereotypical Playboy bunny outfit consists of a [[black leotard|black]] [[strapless leotard]], [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears]], a [[fake tail|fake]] [[rabbit tail]], [[wrist cuffs]], a [[detached collar]] with a [[bowtie]], [[fishnet pantyhose]] or [[fishnet thighhighs|thighhighs]], and [[high heels]]. Common variations include different outfit colors, or omission of some or all of the accessories.

A [b]Playboy Bunny[/b] was originally a cocktail [[waitress]] who worked at a [[Playboy]] Club. The first Playboy Bunny costume was introduced when Hugh Hefner opened his first Playboy Club in Chicago in 1960.

title: kursk_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of [i]Kursk[/i], a Soviet heavy cruiser design that was meant as an aircraft-carrying cruiser.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[red eyes]], [[horns]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a [[white coat]], [[two-tone dress]] with a [[side slit]], and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]].

In real life, she was the "Project X":[https://twitter.com/HeraldPOfficial/status/1637764168983126016] derivative of a prior heavy cruiser design with larger guns than the treaty standard while also carrying a large seaplane complement, similar to [[Mogami (Azur Lane)|]] and the [i]Tone[/i]-class of Japan. Records suggest this was due to Soviet espionage of Japanese naval activities, yet the project never got beyond planning stage.

h4. Appearance

title: hai_tien_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Chinese protected cruiser [i]Hai Tien[/i].  Her name (海天) means "Heavenly Seas".

Historically, she and her sister ship [[Hai Chi (Azur Lane)|]] were the largest ships China had for several decades (compare their 4,300 tons while [[Ning Hai (Azur Lane)|]] had a displacement of 2,500 tons). She was originally commissioned in 1899 and ran aground in 1904 while navigating to the Yangtze in foggy conditions.

In Azur Lane, she and her sister [i]Hai Chi[/i] are reclassed as light cruisers to conform to existing gameplay ship types.

title: forza
body:
A series of [[car]] [[racing]] games published by [[Microsoft]] for the Xbox family of consoles, and later for [[computer|PC]].

The series is considered a "simcade", encouraging realistic driving styles but with enough leniency to be accessible to beginners and casual players. Forza is particularly notable for being one of the first racing franchises to feature an in-depth decal and livery customizer, making intricate custom [[racecar]] and [[itasha]] designs prevalent in the series.

The franchise is split into two sub-series - Motorsport and Horizon. The Motorsport games feature closed-track racing on a mix of real and original [[racetrack]]s with cars varying from everyday road cars to [[Le Mans prototype]]s and [[formula racer]]s. The Horizon games are open-world games set at music/motorsports festivals in scenic locations throughout the world, primarily featuring production cars.

h4. Entries

* [[Forza Motorsport 3]]
* [[Forza Motorsport (2023)]]
* [[Forza Horizon 4]]
* [[Forza Horizon 5]]

title: marriage_certificate
body:
A marriage certificate between two characters. It originated as a [[meme]] template on Pixiv, likely as one of their many exercises in creativity.

All tagged entries involve the use of a template:

* Pictures of the groom (left) and bride (right)
* Names of the groom (left) and bride (right), including both kanji reading and pronunciations where possible
* Date of Birth of groom (left) and bride (right)
* A brief description of how the couple first met
* Occupation of groom (left) and bride (right)
* Miscellaneous other comments from the couple and/or any witnesses (friends, family, enemies, etc.)
* Signature and hanko stamp of husband (left) and wife (right). Also acceptable are fingerprints, personal logos, bloodstains, etc. A simple signature is fine if nothing else will do.

h4. See also
* [[Marriage certificate (object)]], when a marriage certificate appears as an object in an image.

title: 7-eleven
body:
An international chain of 24-hour [[convenience store]]s that originated and is still headquartered in Dallas, Texas, United States. Its stores are located in 19 countries (as of November 2021), Japan having one of its largest markets.

In 1991, Japanese affiliate Ito-Yokado acquired 70% of 7-Eleven and it was reorganized as a wholly owned subsidiary of 7-Eleven Japan. As of 2005, it is now held by the Japanese diversified retail group Seven & I Holdings Co., Ltd. (which also owns [[Denny's]] Japan).

Not to be confused with [[double-parted bangs]], which concerns the bangs rather than the hair across the scalp.

title: huadian
body:
Traditional Chinese makeup, which may be located on the [[forehead mark|forehead]], [[mark_between_eyes|between the eyebrows]], the [[marking on cheek|cheeks]], the temples,  and/or the [[dimple facial mark|dimples]].

Also known as: huazi, mianhua, meizi, Shouyang makeup, and plum blossom makeup.

Huadian were historically worn by women - however, in fantasy depictions based in China, or with Chinese themes, there are depictions of men with similar  or identical markings. This is used sometimes - though not always - as an indicator of supernatural abilites, deity status, or other non-human traits. This may derive from Buddhist influence, with an example being Nezha (哪吒), a male diety from Chinese and Indian mythology, or Erlang Shen, of whom is sometimes depicted with his third eye as a [[forehead mark]].

h4.See Also
* [[Bindi]] (Hindu forehead mark)

title: shoulder_support
body:
Someone using own shoulder(s) to support another's body. Typically involves holding up another person by wrapping their arm around the supporting person's shoulders or letting the supported person hold on the supporting person's shoulder with their hand(s). If the supporting person is on the side of the supported person, it's most likely [[human crutch]].

If a character has an object on their shoulder, use [[over shoulder]] instead.

body:
An open-palmed strike, usually directed to one's face.

Contrary to [[punching]], a slap is mostly used to punish, wake up, stimulate or humiliate rather than harm another person. This is why it is mostly used by girlfriends, sergeants, bosses, [[bdsm]] partners, parents and teachers.

Very common in certain cultures, like [[Japan]].

title: carl_clover
body:
[[BlazBlue]] character.

Carl Clover is a young vigilante who dropped out of the Military Academy. 

A talented young boy and first class vigilante, Carl has brought many criminals to justice with the aid of his mysterious doll Nirvana, which he believes to be his elder sister, Ada Clover. Carl heads to Kagutsuchi to retrieve the bounty for [[Ragna the Bloodedge]]. He is a former classmate of [[Noel vermillion]], [[Jin Kisaragi]], [[Makoto Nanaya]], and [[Tsubaki Yayoi]] when they were in the Military Academy, but he dropped out. Carl wants to get revenge on his father [[Relius Clover]], for what he did to Carl's older sister, Ada. In some part of his story, Carl meets [[Shishigami Bang]], and Bang calls him his "cute little disciple". 

He is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

title: zhou_yaqin_learns_medal_biting_(meme)
body:
A viral photos originated from the [[2024 Summer Olympics]] women's team balance gymnastic event medal ceremony.

The photos featuring Chinese silver medalist [[Zhou Yaqin]] looking at the Italian gold medalist [[Alice D'Amato]] and her bronze medalist compatriot [[Manila Esposito]] [[biting]] their [[medal]]s, as she is unaware of the medal biting tradition of the event. Zhou would later replicate the act after some encouragement from Alice and Manila.

title: friends_(tv_series)
body:
[b]Friends[/b] was an American sitcom that aired for over ten seasons from September 22, 1994, to May 6, 2004. The show, staring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer, follows six friends in their 20s to early 30s and their lives in Manhattan, New York City.

The show was a big hit when it aired, winning several awards including Six Emmys, with its final episode being the most watch finale in 2004.

title: aya_(project_moon)
body:
A character in [[Limbus Company]], appearing in Canto I.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with [[sidelocks]], an [[ahoge]], and has an [[x hair ornament]]. In canon, she has her [[closed eyes|eyes closed]] more often than not, but they are revealed to be [[yellow eyes|yellow]]. She wears a black-and-white [[jacket]] with [[blue trim|blue-trimmed]] [[lapels]] and a matching [[blue scarf]], along with [[black pants]] with a [[red belt|red]] [[thigh belt]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She uses an [[energy weapon|energy-based]] [[shotgun]] in combat.

Her outfit notably mirrors her coworker, [[Yuri (project moon)|]]'s, which inverts the red and blue.

h4. See also
* [[Hopkins (project moon)|]]
* [[Yuri (project moon)|]]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

body:

He has [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[brown hair]] and [[aqua eyes]] behind [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]]. He wears the uniform of his Fixer Office, wearing a black-and-white [[jacket]] with [[blue trim|blue-trimmed]] [[lapels]], [[black pants]] with a [[blue belt|blue]] [[thigh belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. His version of the uniform has a prominent [[high collar]] that reaches his chin, and he uses a [[crossbow]] as his weapon, with the [[quiver]] hanging on his lower back.

title: hayate_no_gotoku!
body:
A [i]Weekly Shounen Sunday[/i] manga series by [[Hata Kenjirou]], with an accompanying light novel series written by Tsukiji Toshihiko, and an anime adaptation by Synergy SP (Season 1) and [[J.C. Staff]] (Season 2) with the third season being produced by Manglobe, titled [i]Can't Take My Eyes Off You[/i]. The fourth season is titled [i]Cuties[/i], also by Manglobe.

[[Ayasaki Hayate]] is an unlucky boy forced into paying off debts by his extremely irresponsible parents. After running from home once they went too far, Hayate met [[Sanzen'in Nagi]], an extremely spoiled, sheltered heiress, who offers him a job as her butler. Together with Nagi's personal maid [[Maria (hayate no gotoku!)|]], Hayate and his employer get into several misadventures.

title: sumitomo_ntk-62
body:
The standard issue 7.62×51mm NATO general-purpose [[machine gun]] of the Japan Self-Defense Forces. Also known as the Type 62 GPMG. When first issued it fulfilled both light and medium machine gun support throughout the JGSDF.

Though the "Sumitomo Heavy Industries":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumitomo_Heavy_Industries]-produced [[M249 SAW]] firing the smaller 5.56×45mm NATO cartridge has largely replaced it in the light machine gun role at the squad level in the [[japan ground self-defense force|JGSDF]], the NTK-62 still plays the support role at platoon and company level for the infantry as a medium machine gun firing the more powerful [[ammunition|cartridge]]. It also continues to be used as a co-axial weapon in various armored vehicles, including [[tank]]s and [[armored personnel carrier|APC]]s. Like all modern Japanese-made [[gun|firearms]], it was never exported.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Type 62 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sumitomo Type 62":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumitomo_Type_62
* "Special ops.org: Sumitomo Type 62":https://special-ops.org/sumitomo-ntk-62-machine-gun/

title: adventurer_(ff14)
body:
The Midlander [[Hyur]] who acts as a poster boy for [[Final Fantasy XIV]], also known as the [[Warrior of Light (ff14)|]]. Called many names by fans, whether it be "Hiroshi" by the Japanese (after Director "NQ" Hiroshi Takai), or by English speakers "Meteor" (from Meteor Survivor), "CG Midlander", or even "Derplander" affectionately.

Shown in different Jobs in each installment:
* Final Fantasy XIV 1.0: Gladiator/Archer
* A Realm Reborn: [[Warrior (final fantasy)|]]
* Heavensward: [[Dragoon (final fantasy)|]]
* Stormblood: [[Monk (final fantasy)|]]/[[Samurai (final fantasy)|]]
* Shadowbringers: [[Dark Knight (final fantasy)|]]
* Endwalker: [[Paladin (final fantasy)|]]
* Dawntrail: [[Viper (final fantasy)|]]

For player created adventurers, use [[Warrior of Light (ff14)|]] only.

title: yi_sang_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.01 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on both the 20th century Korean poet "Kim Hae-Gyeong":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_Sang and the protagonist of their novel "The Wings":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wings_(novel). 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[black eyes]] with noticeable [[bags under eyes|bags]], an almost permanently [[exhausted]] expression, and carries a [[satchel]] containing a [[book]] and [[dagger]] across all of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], and a [[black coat]] he wears [[coat on shoulders|over his shoulders]]. 

He primarily wields a [[dagger|saingeom]] in his base identity, and carries a [[book]] and [[satchel]] bag labeled with the Korean name '하융' ('Ha Yong', a pseudonym used by Kim Hae-Gyeong) across all of his identities.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026033

title: skeletal_hand
body: A hand that consists exclusively of bone, while other parts of the body consist of flesh or even [[mechabare]].

title: car_part
body:
A visible mechanical part (or multiple parts) of a [[car]], such as an [[engine]] or its part, a [[turbocharger]], a brake disc, transmission etc, excluding [[wheel]]s and fasteners ([[bolt (hardware)|]]s, [[screw]]s and [[nut (hardware)|nut]]s). The parts may be either removed from a car, or be installed on it, but be visible enough to properly identify, such as under the open hood, or exposed by design (such as in post #5877255).

Vehicle body parts (bumpers, fenders etc) count too, as long as they are removed from the vehicle at least partially.

Not to be confused with the similar tag [[mechabare]], which should be used for [[android]]s, [[mecha]]s and other robot-like characters.

Related Twitter tags: #むき出しのエンジンを見せてもっと

[i]TBD: create a broader tag vehicle_part, which would include tanks, rail vehicles, etc.[/i]

title: mechanical_pussy
body:
The character is a [[cyborg]] or [[android]] with mechanical, robotic or [[mechabare|cybernetic]] [[pussy|female genitalia]], the nature of which is obvious, for example, if the character is partially [[disassembly|disassembled]], [[damaged]], shown through an [[x-ray]], or an organ has undeniable external signs of artificial origin. At a minimum, if the genital module has a visible border on the skin, separating it from the rest of the body.
Also suitable for single images of cybernetic or robotic female genitalia intended to be mounted as part of a [[robot]], [[android]] or [[cyborg]] body.
The tag is not used for an [[artificial vagina]], which is just a [[sex toy]].
The tag is not relevant if the artificial nature of the [[pussy]] is implied by the nature of the character, but not visually.

title: plastic_skin
body:
Some or all of the character's skin is made of plastic. As a [[metal skin]], a common feature of many [[cyborg]]s and [[android]]s that are not designed to look convincingly human, and is also common to some [[doll]]s and other similar creatures.

Plastic skin can be painted in a natural color, but differ in [[shiny skin|shine]] and the presence of [[joints]], or have any other colors. Most often white, gray or black.

Don't use this tag for characters that canonically have [[metal skin]] unless it actually appears to be made of plastic.

This tag shouldn't be used for non-humanoid [[robot]]s since they aren't typically meant to have "skin" anyway.

h4.See also

* [[mechabare]]
* [[robot joints]]
* [[doll joints]]
* [[shiny skin]]

title: metal_skin
body:
Some or all of of a character's skin is made of metal. A common feature of many [[cyborg|cyborgs]] and [[android|androids]] that aren't designed to look convincingly human, but it may also be the case with non-mechanical beings such as certain [[golem|golems]] or [[elemental_(creature)|elementals]].

Don't use this tag unless the skin actually appears to be made of metal. Seams, overlapping plates, and a lustrous finish are valid reasons to use this tag. Skin that is simply grey or yellow is not; that's what the [[grey skin]] and [[yellow skin]] tags are for. Shiny coverings that aren't actually metal might be [[scales]] or a [[carapace]].

This tag shouldn't be used for non-humanoid [[robot]]s or [[mecha]] since they aren't typically meant to have "skin" anyway.

h4.See also

* [[exoskeleton]]
* [[mecha musume]]
* [[mechabare]]

title: erlking_heathcliff_(project_moon)
body:
[spoiler] A Mirror World version of [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]], who after the death of his version of [[Catherine (project moon)|]] went mad with grief and resolved to kill every [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]] in every Mirror World. He is one of the primary antagonists of Canto VI.[/spoiler]

He has a generally [[disheveled]] appearance, with [[messy hair|messy]] [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] and [[dark skin]] featuring [[scar|scars]]. He wears a [[brown coat|brown]] [[overcoat]] over a [[black vest|black]] [[waistcoat]], accessorized with two [[shoulder belt|shoulder belts]] and one [[high belt]], along with [[brown pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. He also wears a [[half capelet]], a [[scarf]], and leather [[gauntlets]].

[spoiler]He initially disguises himself as Matthew, the boss of the Dead Rabbits and [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]]'s former friend.
Erlking Heathcliff is erased from history with the deletion of Catherine and is not playable. His playable equivalent is [[Wuthering Heights (identity) (project moon)|Wild Hunt Heathcliff]], who can be differentiated from him by having an [[eyepatch]].[/spoiler]

title: inoue_takina
body:
A character in [[Lycoris Recoil]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]]. She wears the [[lycoris uniform]] that consists of a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[blue dress|blue]] & [[grey dress|grey]] [[pleated dress]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[green ribbon|green]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[blue belt]]. She also wears [[black male underwear|black]] [[boxers]] for underwear, though she later switches to wearing [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts under dress|shorts under her dress]] (but not as underwear).

Her cafe attire, where she works as a [[waitress]], consists of a [[blue kimono]], [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[waist bow]], and an [[apron]]. She styles her hair in [[twintails]].

Usually depicting [[holding gun|holding a gun]] with [[trigger discipline]].

h4. See Also

* "Lycoris Recoil Wiki: Inoue Takina":https://lycoris-recoil.fandom.com/wiki/Takina_Inoue

body:

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] to [[white hair]] stylized in a [[bob cut]] with [[bangs]]. She wears a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] and the [[lycoris uniform]] that consists of a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[red dress|red]] & [[grey dress|grey]] [[pleated dress]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[red belt]].

Her cafe attire, where she works as a [[waitress]], consists of a [[red kimono]], [[green bow|green]] [[waist bow]], and an [[apron]].

Usually depicting [[holding gun|holding a gun]] with [[trigger discipline]], and an [[Heart|Artificial Heart]]. Seems to be a devotee of the [[center axis relock stance]].

She is voiced by [[Anzai Chika]].

title: demon's_souls
body:
[b]Demon's Souls[/b] is a 2009 action role-playing game developed by [[fromsoftware|FromSoftware]] for the PlayStation 3 under the supervision of Japan Studio. It was published in Japan by [[sony|Sony Computer Entertainment]] in February, in North America by [[atlus|Atlus USA]] in October, and in PAL territories by [[bandai namco|Namco Bandai Partners]] in June 2010. The game was made as a spiritual successor to FromSoftware's [[King's Field]] series. Later it would received its own successor in the [[Dark Souls (series)|Dark Souls trilogy]].

It was remade in 2020 for the PS5 by Bluepoint Games.

title: m.d._geist
body:
[b]M.D. Geist[/b] ([i]"Sokihei M.D. Gaisuto"[/i], literally [i]"Demon-Garbed Soldier M.D. Geist"[/i]) is a 1986 40-minute post-apocalyptic [[science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]] OVA directed by [[Oohata Kouichi]]. Famous for its powerful soundtrack, over the top action and violence, intricate mechanical design by Oohata, multiple animation errors and bizarre story, M.D. Geist is generally seen as a bad production, but has also become somewhat of a cult classic.

In the future, the war-torn planet of Jerra has been locked in a war between the Earth government loyalists and the Nexrum corporation for decades. To counter Nexrum's advanced weapons, the Earth government developed one-man armies, the Most Dangerous Soldiers. However they proved to be far too strong, and most eventually lost their minds and went on rampage. Being one of the surviving Most Dangerous Soldiers, [[MDS-02 GEIST]] was put into stasis inside a satellite in Jerra's orbit. Years later, the satellite prison crashes on the desolate planet and Geist reawakens. He recovers a Powered Suit, battles with bandits and units of the Nexrum military and eventually joins a group of Earth army commandos in a mission to deactivate the secret doomsday weapon on Jerra: a self-replicating robot swarm known as "Death Force". However, there's more than meets the eye to Geist.

A sequel OVA, "M.D. Geist II: Death Force", was made a decade later, alongside a comic book prequel. The 1986 OVA has also received a Director's Cut edition, which fixes the animation errors, adds more blood and some new footage.

title: school_swimsuit
body:
A standard school-issued [[one-piece_swimsuit|one-piece swimsuit]] usually blue, black, white or grey in color sometimes with the wearer's name written or printed on a white [[name_tag|name tag]] stitched across the chest. The style has evolved over the years.

The original [[old_school_swimsuit|old school swimsuit]] has thicker shoulder straps, vertical seams over torso and a [[school_swimsuit_flap|flap]] over the groin.

The [[new_school_swimsuit|new school swimsuit]] is identical in style to the old school swimsuit except with no flap over the groin.

The [[competition_school_swimsuit|competition school swimsuit]] has thinner shoulder straps, is unseamed and has no flap over the groin. It is closer in style to the more modern [[competition_swimsuit|competition swimsuit]], but still in the style of a school swimsuit.

The [[nontraditional_school_swimsuit|non-traditional school swimsuit]] is a swimsuit that has been patterned after a school swimsuit, but is two-piece, frilled, or has other alterations to it that deviate from the norm.

The [[alternate_color_school_swimsuit|alternate color school swimsuit]] is a school swimsuit depicted in colors that deviate from the usual blue, black, white or grey.

h4. Examples

* !post #7165220

h4. See also

* [[one-piece_swimsuit|one-piece swimsuit]]

title: sunflower
body:
A native flowering plant from the Americas.  The common sunflower is most recognizable by their single large yellow apical "flower," with an initially greenish center that turns yellow-brown and then blackish as it matures.  They typically grow to heights of around 3 meters (10 feet) with record plants reach heights of 9+ meters (30+ feet). Sunflowers are grown for various purposes such as for food, cooking oil, livestock feed, and decoration. 

Domestic sunflowers come in a variety of colors beyond the common yellow, with colors such as cream color, gold, orange, red, mahogany, and chocolate brown.  While the common types only feature a singular apical flower (one that grows at the tip of the central stem), there are also varieties that grow many additional branching flowers.  The large blooms of the sunflower while commonly called a "flower" is in fact a "flower head," a structure composed of many smaller flowers (florets) that together appear as one single flower.

Sunflowers and their relatives are heliotropic while they're developing, meaning that the plants will turn following the direction of the sun during the day.  As they get closer to maturing, the plant stiffen and lose it's ability to track the sun. Due to their heliotropic nature, most plants will mature locked facing toward the East, the direction of the rising sun.

h4. Examples

* !post #6797029

h4. See also

* [[Sunflower seed]]
* [[Tag group:flowers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Common Sunflower":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_sunflower]

title: tyrannosaurus_rex
body:
A large theropod carnivorous [[dinosaur]]. Often referred to as "T-Rex" for short, from the type specimen's scientific name [i]Tyrannosaurus rex[/i].

While there are at least five other species of [i]Tyrannosaurus[/i] known to science, the type specimen [i]T-Rex[/i] is arguably the most popular species of non-avian dinosaur, stemming from the discovery of several complete fossil specimens, along with its depictions in media as an apex predator. Particularly in [[Jurassic Park]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7912065

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tyrannosaurus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyrannosaurus

title: payphone
body:
A public [[phone]], with payment by inserting money (usually coins). Often seen furnished inside [[phone booth]]s and seen alongside [[phone book]]s.

Traditional Japanese payphones are fat and green and often include a card reader in addition to a typical coin slot.

Don't use this tag where a [[phone booth]] is visible, but the payphone inside is not. Do use it instead of phone booth for free-standing or wall-mounted payphones without any sort of enclosure.

h4. Examples

* !post #3832440
* !post #7748417

h4. See also

* [[telephone card (medium)|]]

* [[phone book]]

body:

Usually takes the form of a flat 6in/15cm slab, functioning as a do-it-all pocket computer primarily controlled via touch screen. Fictional characters are seen with them more often as they permeate modern life.

title: phone_booth
body:
A small structure furnished with a [[payphone]] (and often a [[phone book]]) and designed for making calls. Usually the booth has a door to provide privacy and a window.  This tag should ideally be used for glassed-in enclosures with a door, but at minimum should have at least privacy dividers and/or a weatherproof roof.  Don't use this for open-air free-standing or plain wall-mounted [[payphone]]s.

Common designs include the traditional British red multi-paned phone booths, and the more modern looking aluminum and glass boxes common in Japan and elsewhere.

These usually feature the standard fat green Japanese payphones.

h4. Examples

* !post #838703
* !post #3488476

h4. See also

* [[payphone]]
* [[phone book]]

title: linton_(project_moon)
body:
The husband of [[Catherine_(project_moon)|]] and based on Edgar Linton from Wuthering Heights, serving as an antagonist in Canto VI of [[Limbus Company]].

He has [[pale skin]] and [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]], [[blonde hair]], and is seen with [[bags under eyes|bags under his]] [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[black coat]] over a [[black vest]] and [[white shirt]] with a [[black necktie]] along with [[black pants|black]] [[dress pants]] and [[black footwear|matching]] [[dress shoes]].

title: farmwatch_(e.g.o)
body:
The personal e.g.o of [spoiler] [[Dongrang (project moon)|Dongrang]].[/spoiler]

Its clothing consists of a [[white hanbok]] over a [[brown coat]] with a [[rice hat]], [[brown gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], all of which are [[dirty clothes|soiled]]. It also tends to give the wearer [[horns]], and the weapon used with it is a [[scythe]].

title: sunshower_(e.g.o)
body:

It typically appears as a [[brown raincoat|brown]] or [[white raincoat|white]] [[dirty clothes|soiled]] [[raincoat]] as a piece of clothing, or as an [[umbrella]] as a weapon. Its user may also have [[fox ears]] and/or a [[fox tail]].

h4. Canon Examples:
* !post #7171055
* !post #7250608

title: drifting_fox
body:
An [[list_of_project_moon_characters|abnormality]] first appearing in [[Limbus Company]] whom the [[E.G.O (project moon)|E.G.O]] of [[Sunshower (e.g.o)|]] is derived from.

It resembles an [[oversized animal|oversized]] [[fox]] with [[umbrella|umbrellas]], including [[broken umbrella|broken ones]], lodged inside of its body. It also uses one as a [[weapon]], which it holds with its [[weapon in mouth|mouth]].

title: every_catherine_(project_moon)
body:
A [[spoilers|spoiler]] character from Canto VI of [[Limbus Company]].

She is a [[ghost]]-like apparition of [[Catherine (project moon)|]] with [[grey hair]], [[white skin]], and [[blank eyes]]. She wears a [[greyscale]] version of her outfit, with a [[white dress]] and [[black jacket]] with [[black gloves]].

title: nelly_(project_moon)
body:
[[Heathcliff (project moon)|]] and [[Catherine (project moon)|]]'s former caretaker and a character who appears in Canto VI of [[Limbus Company]]. She coincidentally bears a passing resemblance to [[Outis (project moon)|]] and is based on the character of the same name from "Wuthering Heights":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuthering_Heights.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[high ponytail]] and [[brown eyes]], and [[dark skin]]. While referred to as a butler in-game, she wears a [[frills|frilled]] [[maid]] uniform including the [[maid headdress|headdress]] and [[maid apron|apron]], along with a [[grey ascot]]. In combat, she uses [[cutlery]], especially [[knife|knives]], as [[throwing knife|thrown weapons]].

title: hieda_no_akyuu
body:
The "Memory of [[Gensokyo]]".

Resident historian of the [[Touhou]] series and ninth (and current) incarnation of the "Child of Miare", possessing a photographic memory as well as the ability to recall memories from her previous incarnations ([[hieda no aichi|Aichi]], [[hieda no ani|Ani]], [[hieda no ami|Ami]], [[hieda no ayo|Ayo]], [[hieda no ago|Ago]], [[hieda no amu|Amu]], [[hieda no anana|Anana]] and [[hieda no aya|Aya]]). In-universe author of [i]Perfect Memento in Strict Sense[/i] and [i]Symposium of Post-Mysticism[/i], encyclical works on the various faces, places, and dates in Gensokyo. Also writes mystery fiction under the pen name [[Agatha Chris Q outfit (touhou)|Agatha Chris Q]]. Her original, "zeroth" incarnation was the author [[Hieda no Are]], writer of the Kojiki.

After it was revealed that all Children of Miare generally live for around 30 years in [i]Strange Creators of Outer World[/i], some fans began to count the days until Akyuu's 30th birthday, which would be, according to [i]Perfect Memento[/i], around August/September 2024 (earliest August 7, latest September 6). However, ZUN has confirmed that Akyuu wouldn't die, and that the other characters wouldn't grow old, as the series runs on 'Sazae-san time', a floating timeline (commonly called "Comic Book Time" in the west due to its heavy use in that media). This didn't stop fans from awaiting the day. Around August 7th, 2024, fans "across":[https://twitter.com/richard_effendi/status/1821886649661321351] the world began discussing the death of Hieda no Akyuu.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hieda no Akyuu":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hieda_no_Akyuu

title: winged_fusiliers
body:
[b]Winged Fusiliers[/b] is a Japanese fantasy comic made by the artist [[Asterisk Kome]].

It feature an alternate reality and history, where bird men and women exist and a major change in our history happened. [[World War I]] lasted longer than our own due to the creation of the Ironclads, giant armored and weaponized [[dirigible]]s, cementing the situation of the trench war even harder than before. 

The story separated into two main era between [[World War I]] and the Cold War.

h4. Characters

h5. World War 1

* [[Frances Royce]]
* [[Amelia Shaw]]
* [[Nora Allison]]
* [[Lesley Wilkins]]
* [[Marut_(winged_fusiliers)|]]

h6. Axis

title: iron_man_(2008)
body:
The first movie based on the [[Iron Man (series)|]] series. Released in 2008, and was the first film in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]].
The film stars [[Robert Downey Jr.]] as [[Tony Stark]] / [[Iron Man]] alongside Terrence Howard, Jeff Bridges, Gwyneth Paltrow, Leslie Bibb, and Shaun Toub. In the film, following his escape from captivity by a terrorist group, world-famous industrialist and master engineer Tony Stark builds a mechanized suit of armor and becomes the superhero Iron Man.

title: neofam
body:
A fictional combat [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]Neofam[/b] is an advanced (but cheaper and less powerful) red and white colored version of the [[Vifam]] combat [[Round Vernian]]. 

It's built with more sophisticated sensors so it is usually used for aggressive reconnaissance missions.

title: vifam_trainer
body:
A fictional generic training [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

It is an unarmed version of the [[Vifam]] [[Round Vernian]] painted in a yellow, white and red color scheme.

title: dillfam
body:
A fictional generic combat [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]Dillfam[/b] is the most basic [[soldier]] [[Round Vernian]] of the human colonial defense forces. It is painted in a [[military]] green and white color pattern.

As a ground-based manned battle robot it lacks [[thrusters]] and vernier rockets.

title: torunfam
body:
A fictional combat [[mecha]] from the [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]] anime TV series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]Torunfam[/b] is a human [[military]] [[Round Vernian]] optimized for aerospace missions. It is painted in a light and dark blue color pattern.

title: vifam
body:
The titular fictional [[mecha]] from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]] anime series [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]]. 

The [b]Vifam[/b] is an advanced and powerful all-environment multi-role combat [[Round Vernian]]. It's painted in a dark blue, white and red color pattern.

In [[real life]] it was designed by legendary mecha artist [[Ookawara Kunio]] (famous for his work in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]).

h4.See also
* [[Vifam Trainer]]

title: astrogator_round_vernian
body:
[b]The Astrogator Round Vernian[/b], also known as [b]ARV[/b], is the Earthians' expedient name for the [[mecha]] that the [[kuktonian|Kuktonians]] used in [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]]. The [[Round Vernian]] is a type of Earthian's mecha in the show.

They were [[alien|extraterrestrials]] living in the Ypserlon solar system, and their three habitable planets, including their home planet Kukuto, were polluted by a nuclear war. For over 1000 years, they lived in space colonies built in the asteroid area. Earthians from Earth, 43 light-years away, did not consider them the natives of the solar system, but called them Astrogators.
The Kuktonians' official name for the ARVs was never revealed, but in the story, they called this type of weapon, [b]mobile weapons[/b] (機動兵器), or [b]mobile mecha[/b] (機動メカ).

h4.List of ARVs

* ARV-A [[Wug]]
* ARV-B [[Ruzarga]]

* ARV-E [[Purag]] (appeared in Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam 13)

title: berdan_rifle
body:
The [b]Berdan rifle[/b] is a single-shot, breech-loaded [[rifle]] invented by American engineer Hiram Berdan and is chambered in 10.75×58mmR [[ammunition]]. It was the service rifle of the Imperial Russian Army from 1870 to 1891, and evetually replaced by [[Mosin-Nagant]]. 
This tag covers all the two variants: Berdan I which is a trapdoor breech block gun, and the [[bolt action]] Berdan II.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Berdan rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berdan_rifle
* "Henry Krank.: M1870 Berdan rifle":https://www.henrykrank.com/the-m1870-berdan-rifle/
